title: A condensed-type - critique...
content:
Hello!

Ive been working on a new typeface design for  
newspaper ingress, and book-text.  
The idea is that which is slightly condensed  
but which doesnt appear that way.

I would love to hear some critique and feedback here.  
What do you think I should keep focusing on?  
What are my biggest mistakes.. and so on...  
Its still very much work in Progress.  
(as you for sure can tell especially with upper case)

Please take a look at the PDF,  
(note; I didnt kern the font yet properly, its just for a  
quick sketch)

Dag Brandsaeter

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [typetest\_28-05-06.pdf](http://web.archive.org/web/20150416170156/http:/typophile.com/files/typetest_28-05-06.pdf) | 45.72 KB |
author: DagBrandsaeter

comments.content:
\> slightly condensed but which doesnt appear that way.

You might benefit by reading about the development of Carter's Olympian.

hhp
Looks like a cross between Folio and Gill. Try keeping the thick and thins constant. The capitals are way too thin..

It has a touch of Antique Olive about it. It's pretty crude looking - maybe the stems aren't all the same thickness?

Toby you're right about the caps, in fact they look thinner than the lower case.

Nick Cooke
